message:
Nice Trick to add to your .gitconfig file

lg = git config --global alias.tree 'log --graph --full-history --all --color --date=short --pretty=format:"%Cred%x09%h %Creset%ad%Cblue%d %Creset %s %C(bold)(%an)%Creset"'

Then go to your terminal and run the following: 
$ git lg

data.message: it didn't work for me, i use zsh and added the line to ~/.gitconfig but when i type "git lg" it can't recognize the command, am i missing something.

Because it shouldn't be thrown out in the wild like this in your .gitconfig, it should be scoped under [alias]
Should look like that https://gist.github.com/l0gicpath/7d4f8e9ba803b44a2379
Git configuration files are ini files

Just note that my configurations are different.

If you want to edit your ~/.gitconfig file manually :

1. You should add an [alias] section if it is not there already

2. add the alias in the above command replacing the double quotes surrounding the format with single quotes like this :

[alias]
____lg = log --graph --full-history --all --color --date=short --pretty=format:'%Cred%x09%h %Creset%ad%Cblue%d %Creset %s %C(bold)(%an)%Creset'
Note : I only added underscores in the above comment before "lg" (____lg) to indicate indentation. You should replace them with an indentation.
